page.title: 18TOURISM IN FROLESWORTH
page.content: TOURIST GUIDE TO FROLESWORTH On entering Frolesworth, a village of walls, a doorway on the left leads into The Square. Here there are 16 Almshouses built by Right Hon. John Smith in 1725. They form the three sides of a rectangle around a beautiful well keep garden with old water pump in the middle. Incorporated in The Square is the private chapel for the almshouses. Blacksmith - still in operation Plough & Harrow Inn - the car park on the left-hand side was the site of the village school. St. Nicholas' Church commands a very high point with good views across the surrounding area. Brass & Antique Shop
